de.bfs.radon.omsimulation.data

Class OMBuilding

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.bfs.radon.omsimulation.data.OMBuilding

  • public class OMBuilding
extends java.lang.Object
    Public class OMBuilding used for creating building meta-objects with custom name and all the rooms and cellars used in simulations later. OMB object files are DB4O databases of this type!
    Author:
    A. Schoedon

    • Constructor Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • OMBuilding

        public OMBuilding()
        Empty constructor for creating building objects without any attributes. Only use this to avoid exceptions while running into errors or if you are forced to initialize the object first without the ability to set rooms or other attributes. Empty building objects can not be used for simulations.

      • OMBuilding

        public OMBuilding(java.lang.String name,
          java.util.Date start,
          int roomCount,
          int valueCount,
          OMRoom[] rooms,
          OMRoom[] cellars,
          OMRoom[] miscs)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Constructor for creating building objects to store their rooms. Using this constructor will trigger the generation of all available variations.
        Parameters:
        name - A custom name for the object which is set by the user creating the building.
        start - A custom start date for the building. The date can be choosen either to identify the start date of the measurements or to identify the start date of the simulations. That's up to the user and does not affect the simulations.
        roomCount - The total number of rooms for the building.
        valueCount - The total number of measurements for the building.
        rooms - An array of all normal rooms of the building.
        cellars - An array of all cellar rooms of the building.
        miscs - An array of all misc rooms of the building.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If creating log file or writing logs fails.

        An array of all normal rooms of the building.

      • setRooms

        public void setRooms(OMRoom[] rooms)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Sets an array of all normal rooms of the building. Triggers re-generation of all possible variations. Use with care as this can take a couple of minutes.
        Parameters:
        rooms - An array of all normal rooms of the building.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If creating log file or writing logs fails.

      • getVariationSchemeSix

        public OMRoom[][] getVariationSchemeSix()
        Gets an array of rooms-arrays representing all available variations using six rooms. If there are not enough rooms, this array will be empty.
        Returns:
        An array of rooms-arrays representing all available variations using six rooms.
